Glioma.description: Gliomas are tumors that start in glial cells of the brain or spinal cord.
Glioma.grade: Varies (I-IV); higher grade is more aggressive.
Glioma.prognosis: Highly variable depending on grade, type, and location.

Meningioma.description: Meningiomas are tumors arising from the meninges surrounding the brain and spinal cord.
Meningioma.grade: Mostly benign (Grade I), but can be atypical (Grade II) or malignant (Grade III).
Meningioma.prognosis: Generally good for benign tumors that can be completely removed.

No Tumor.description: No tumor detected in the image.

Pituitary.description: Pituitary tumors are abnormal growths in the pituitary gland. Can be hormone-secreting or non-secreting.
Pituitary.prognosis: Generally good with treatment; depends on hormone involvement and tumor size.
